criteria: Understanding Multiplication and Division of Rational Numbers
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of multiplying or dividing rational numbers.
Student struggles to multiply or divide rational numbers and shows significant errors in computation.
Student can multiply or divide simple rational numbers but makes frequent errors or struggles with negative numbers.
Student can multiply and divide rational numbers, including negative numbers, with some errors or hesitation.
Student consistently and accurately multiplies and divides rational numbers, including negative numbers, with minimal errors.
Student demonstrates a thorough understanding of multiplying and dividing rational numbers, consistently applies properties of operations correctly, and justifies solutions.
Student does not apply properties of operations (e.g., distributive property) when multiplying rational numbers.
Student attempts to apply properties of operations but demonstrates significant misunderstanding and errors.
Student applies properties of operations inconsistently and with errors.
Student applies properties of operations with some accuracy but may not fully understand their application.
Student consistently applies properties of operations accurately when multiplying rational numbers.
Student expertly applies properties of operations to simplify expressions and solve problems involving multiplication and division of rational numbers and provides clear explanations.
Student cannot interpret products of rational numbers in real-world contexts.
Student struggles to interpret products of rational numbers in real-world contexts and provides irrelevant explanations.
Student can provide a basic interpretation of products of rational numbers in real-world contexts but lacks depth.
Student interprets products of rational numbers in real-world contexts with some clarity and provides a reasonable explanation.
Student provides a clear and accurate interpretation of products of rational numbers in real-world contexts, with supporting details.
Student provides insightful and nuanced interpretations of products of rational numbers in complex real-world contexts, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding.
